Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Confine yourself to the present.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Each day provides its own gifts.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The best answer to anger is silence.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Misfortune nobly born is good fortune.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Give yourself a gift, the present moment.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: You can commit injustice by doing nothing.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: How trivial the things we want so passionately are.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Conceal a flaw, and the world will imagine the worst.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Remember that very little is needed to make a happy life.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: I cannot escape death, but at least I can escape the fear of it.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Have I been made for this, to lie under the blankets and keep myself warm?

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Settle on the type of person you want to be and stick to it, whether alone or in company.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Love the hand that fate deals you and play it as your own, for what could be more fitting?

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Choose not to be harmed - and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed – and you haven’t been.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Consider at what price you sell your integrity, but please, for God’s sake, don’t sell it cheap.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: External things are not the problem. It’s your assessment of them. Which you can erase right now.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive – to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Think of the life you have lived until now as over and, as a dead man, see what’s left as a bonus and live it according to Nature.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it
column4: and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: If anyone can refute me – show me I’m making a mistake or looking at things from the wrong perspective–I’ll gladly change. It’s the truth I’m after, and the truth never harmed anyone.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: In your actions, don’t procrastinate. In your conversations, don’t confuse. In your thoughts, don’t wander. In your soul, don’t be passive or aggressive. In your life, don’t be all about business.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Hurry up and live.

Author: Seneca
Quote: He who is brave is free.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Ignorance is the cause of fear.

Author: Seneca
Quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.

Author: Seneca
Quote: While we wait for life, life passes.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Life, if well lived, is long enough.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Only time can heal what reason cannot.

Author: Seneca
Quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Life is long, if you know how to use it.

Author: Seneca
Quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Cease to hope and you will cease to fear.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Difficulty comes from our lack of confidence.

Author: Seneca
Quote: To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.

Author: Seneca
Quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

Author: Seneca
Quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Wealth is the slave of a wise man and the master of a fool.

Author: Seneca
Quote: It is more civilized to make fun of life than to bewail it.

Author: Seneca
Quote: If a man knows not which port he sails, no wind is favorable.

Author: Seneca
Quote: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.

Author: Seneca
Quote: What really ruins our character is the fact that none of us looks back over his life.

Author: Seneca
Quote: It does not matter how many books you have, but how good are the books which you have.

Author: Seneca
Quote: For many men, the acquisition of wealth does not end their troubles, it only changes them.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms, you will be able to use them better when you are older.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Life is very short and anxious for those who forget the past, neglect the present, and fear the future.

Author: Seneca
Quote: When a person spends all his time in foreign travel, he ends by having many acquaintances, but no friends.

Author: Seneca
Quote: It’s not because things are difficult that we dare not venture. It’s because we dare not venture that they are difficult.

Author: Seneca
Quote: This is our big mistake: to think we look forward to death. Most of death is already gone. Whatever time has passed is owned by death.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Nothing, to my way of thinking, is a better proof of a well ordered mind than a man’s ability to stop just where he is and pass some time in his own company.

Author: Seneca
Quote: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don’t have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have.

Author: Seneca
Quote: People are frugal in guarding their personal property
column4: but as soon as it comes to squandering time they are most wasteful of the one thing in which it is right to be stingy

Author: Seneca
Quote: I judge you unfortunate because you have never lived through misfortune. You have passed through life without an opponent–no one can ever know what you are capable of, not even you.

Author: Seneca
Quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing

Author: Epictetus
Quote: No great thing is created suddenly.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: It is difficulties that show what men are.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: You become what you give your attention to.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: If you want something good, get it yourself.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: First learn the meaning of what you say, and then speak.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: A ship should not ride on a single anchor, nor life on a single hope.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?

Author: Epictetus
Quote: First say to yourself what you would be
column4: and then do what you have to do.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Curb your desire–don’t set your heart on so many things and you will get what you need.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Men are disturbed not by things but by the principles and notions which they form concerning things.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Where do I look for good and evil? Not to uncontrollable externals, but within myself to the choices that are my own.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: As time passes we forget what we learned and end up doing the opposite, and hold opinions the opposite of what we should

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not
column4: remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Don’t seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will–then your life will flow well.

Author: Zeno
Quote: Extravagance is its own destroyer.

Author: Zeno
Quote: All the good are friends of one another.

Author: Zeno
Quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.

Author: Zeno
Quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue

Author: Zeno
Quote: Steel your sensibilities, so that life shall hurt you as little as possible.

Author: Zeno
Quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason, and against nature.

Author: Zeno
Quote: No loss should be more regrettable to us than losing our time, for it’s irretrievable.

Author: Musonius Rufus
Quote: Since every man dies, it is better to die with distinction than to live long.

Author: Musonius Rufus
Quote: Humanity must seek what is NOT simple and obvious using the simple and obvious.

Author: Musonius Rufus
Quote: Thus whoever destroys human marriage destroys the home, the city – the whole human race.

Author: Musonius Rufus
Quote: We begin to lose our hesitation to do immoral things when we lose our hesitation to speak of them.

Author: Musonius Rufus
Quote: Only by exhibiting actions in harmony with the sound words which he has received will anyone be helped by philosophy.

Author: Musonius Rufus
Quote: If you accomplish something good with hard work, the labor passes quickly, but the good endures, if you do something shameful in pursuit of pleasure, the pleasure passes quickly, but the shame endures

Author: Diogenes
Quote: Blushing is the color of virtue.

Author: Diogenes
Quote: The mob is the mother of tyrants.

Author: Diogenes
Quote: Poverty is a virtue which one can teach oneself.

Author: Diogenes
Quote: He with the most who is content with the least.

Author: Diogenes
Quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.

Author: Diogenes
Quote: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.

Author: Diogenes
Quote: Dogs and philosophers do the greatest good and get the fewest rewards.

Author: Cato
Quote: In doing nothing men learn to do evil.

Author: Cato
Quote: Don't promise twice what you can do at once.

Author: Cato
Quote: Old age isn't so bad when you consider the alternatives.

Author: Cato
Quote: Bitter are the roots of study, but how sweet their fruit.

Author: Cato
Quote: Consider it the greatest of all virtues to restrain the tongue.

Author: Cato
Quote: The best way to keep good acts in memory is to refresh them with new.

Author: Cato
Quote: I begin to speak only when I’m certain what I’ll say isn’t better left unsaid.

Author: Cicero
Quote: Let your desires be ruled by reason.

Author: Cicero
Quote: Not for ourselves alone are we born.

Author: Cicero
Quote: We must not say every mistake is a foolish one.

Author: Cicero
Quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others.

Author: Viktor Frankl
Quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

Author: Viktor Frankl
Quote: What man actually needs is not a tensionless state but rather the striving and struggling for some goal worthy of him.

Author: Heraclitus
Quote: You could not step twice into the same river.

Author: Cleanthes
Quote: Fate guides the willing, but drags the unwilling.

Author: Chrysippus
Quote: There could be no justice, unless there were also injustice, no courage, unless there were cowardice, no truth, unless there were falsehood.

Author: Iroh
Quote: Life happens wherever you are, whether you make it or not.

Author: Iroh
Quote: Good times become good memories, but bad times become good lessons.

Author: Iroh
Quote: Sometimes the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else.

Author: Iroh
Quote: Pride is not the opposite of shame, but it's source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.

Author: Iroh
Quote: Failure is only the opportunity to begin again. Only this time, more wisely.

Author: Iroh
Quote: You will find that if you look for the light, you can often find it, but if you look for the dark, that is all you will ever see.

Author: Iroh
Quote: In the darkest times, hope is something you give yourself. That is the meaning of inner strength.

Author: Iroh
Quote: Sometimes life is like this dark tunnel. You can't always see the light at the end of the tunnel, but if you just keep moving, you will come to a better place.
